LEADERSHIP IN DOWNTOWN MELBOURNE
Leadership and decision-making for Downtown Melbourne governs as
Melbourne Main Street
, a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization dedicated to revitalizing and enhancing the economic growth of the district. Get to know the Melbourne Main Street Board of Directors and committed team.
MELBOURNE MAIN STREET BOARD OF DIRECTORS
OFFICERS
Cassandra Hartford
BOARD CHAIR, 2024-PRESENT, DIRECTOR, 2021-PRESENT
BIO
Cassandra Hartford is a distinguished professional with years of experience in real estate and client relations. Currently, Cassandra occupies many roles that allow her to utilize her exceptional skill set to its fullest potential.
As a Real Estate Advisor, Cassandra aims to be a beacon of knowledge and guidance for all of her clients. Cassandra specializes in a variety of asset classes; anything from residential real estate, to commercial real estate, investment portfolios, and development. She is well-known for her dedication and unwavering commitment to each individual. Over the years, Cassandra has developed an ever-expanding network and continues to build lasting relationships with many loyal clients. As a passionate professional, Cassandra takes pride in staying up-to-date with current market trends. Her natural interest in real estate and innate desire to help others can be directly attributed to her stellar reputation and track record.
In her free time, Cassandra loves spending time with her family, tending to her Koi Fish, or catching a local music or comedy show. She also enjoys Improv Acting and giving back to her community.
Mike Hill
VICE-CHAIR 2025-PRESENT, DIRECTOR, 2024-PRESENT
BIO
Michael Hill is a small business owner, he and his wife co-manage Tuckaway Shores Resort in Indialantic, FL. He truly understands how important volunteering and community involvement is to the local community. That is evidenced by his active participation in local government and engagement in multiple organizations including Melbourne Main Street and the Melbourne Chamber of Commerce; organizations that promote and make a measurable impact to the local economy. His passion is contributing his time and efforts to the continued growth and revitalization of our local community, including historic downtown Melbourne.
Michael’s career began in the United States Army where he served for over 20 years with distinction and retired in 2004. He held numerous positions during his career from an Airborne Artilleryman to the Director of Training Development where he was responsible for the daily operations and management of the US Army Recruiting School. During his career he was stationed at Ft. Bragg, NC, Vicenza, Italy, Ft. Jackson, SC, and multiple assignments with the US Army Recruiting Command in the Northeast. Upon retirement from the US Army, Michael held multiple positions with both non-profit and for-profit companies in sales and operations roles. In those organizations he held local, regional, and V-level roles providing him exceptional experience that he leveraged to grow those organizations.
Michael loves spending time with his wife Pam, daughters Brandi and Kristi and his grandchildren Carolina and Caleb. He is very active and enjoys outdoor activities such as paddleboarding, biking, one-wheeling, downhill skiing, and paramotoring.
Lory Milton
TREASURER 2024-PRESENT, DIRECTOR, 2023-PRESENT
BIO
Lory Milton is the current Vice President, Commercial Loan Officer at Marine Bank and Trust.
She works closely with many small–business owners in the region building relationships to help business owners achieve their dreams.
Lory is a University of Central Florida graduate with a Bachelor’s in Criminal Justice, and a longtime resident of the Space Coast.
Growing up in Melbourne, Lory has enjoyed watching and being a part of the Space Coast’s growth and is excited for what the future holds for Downtown Melbourne.
Lory serves as PTO Vice President at her son’s school, is a Board Member of The Gift Angel Society, and enjoys volunteering with the Brevard Children’s Hunger Project.
Jordan Williams
SECRETARY 2024-PRESENT, DIRECTOR, 2023-PRESENT
BIO
Jordan Williams owns Downtown Divas in Downtown Melbourne as well as Tangled Rose, in Downtown Melbourne and Cocoa Village.  She has a special affinity for downtowns and will be bringing her fresh perspective and vision for social media marketing, content development, and event planning to the Board of Directors.
Jordan is looking forward to marketing DTMB as a destination for shopping, playing, and exploring while making deeper connections with the other businesses in Downtown Melbourne.
DIRECTORS
Kat Butler
DIRECTOR, 2024-PRESENT
BIO
Kat Butler, North American Properties
David Cable
DIRECTOR, 2020-PRESENT
BIO
David Cable is a multi-million dollar, full-service, realtor with RE/MAX Elite. Working with his team of trusted local business partners, he’s able to successfully fulfill his clients’ every need, from start to finish and beyond. In addition to supporting Brevard public schools,  he is involved in several charities that are largely focused on funding women, children and animals. He is also actively involved in the community as an Executive Board member of the Melbourne Chamber of Commerce and an active member of the Palm Bay Chamber of Commerce. David and his wife, Wendy, live beachside in Indialantic.
Bernard (Bernie) Clevens
DIRECTOR, 2025-PRESENT
BIO
Bernard S. Clevens is the Founder and Principal of Thematic Capital Group (“TCG”), a real estate investment firm in Melbourne, Florida. As of December 2024, the company manages approximately $28M in assets. The company focuses on value-add industrial real estate investments in the southeast.
Raised in Melbourne, Florida, Mr. Clevens believes that Downtown Melbourne is well positioned to benefit from a great location, a storied history and charming downtown streets. He joined the Board to drive further economic growth to Downtown Melbourne. The TCG portfolio includes a property in Downtown Melbourne, so his firm has a direct interest in the success of the local business community.
He and his wife are both from Brevard County and are proud to raise their two children in Melbourne. Mr. Clevens earned his bachelor’s degree from Bowdoin College and holds an MBA from Emory University’s Goizueta Business School.
Matthew Flores
DIRECTOR, 2024-PRESENT
BIO
Matthew Flores, BRPH
Don Hemmenway
DIRECTOR, 2024-PRESENT
BIO
Don Hemmenway retired as a Senior Engineering Manager from Renesas Electronics in Palm Bay (formerly Harris Semiconductor) after a 40-year career in microelectronics design and manufacturing.  He was awarded 25 US and European patents, published numerous technical papers, and directly contributed to the implementation of multiple generations of tactical and strategic national defense programs.
Don and his wife, Cathy, raised four children in Brevard County and are extremely proud of their many accomplishments (including six grandchildren!).  In 2019 they moved to a permanent residence on Crane Creek in Downtown Melbourne. Since retirement in 2023, they enjoy daily walks down New Haven Avenue to the harbor, as well as partaking in the diverse dining, shopping, and entertainment opportunities downtown.
Don is passionate about applying his time and talents to improve both Downtown Melbourne and his local Crane Creek Landing community.  He is particularly inspired by the rich history of Downtown Melbourne and would like to improve how that story is delivered to enhance the visitor experience.
Corey Runte
IMMEDIATE PAST CHAIR, 2023;
DIRECTOR, 2019-PRESENT
BIO
Corey serves as Vice President at Certified General Contractors, Inc., located in Historic Downtown Melbourne, bringing a wealth of experience and a deep commitment to community to the Board. A resident of Melbourne Beach with his wife, Krista, and their three young sons, Corey actively engages in local initiatives. He serves as a member of the Economic Development Commission of the Space Coast and has previously chaired the boards of both Melbourne Main Street (MMS) and the City of Melbourne’s Historic & Architectural Review Board. His involvement in Main Street organizations spans over a decade, with a dedicated eight-year tenure at MMS. Corey is passionate about revitalizing Downtown Melbourne and offers the Board a unique and energetic perspective informed by his professional experience in construction and his long-standing commitment to community development.
Toni McGovern
DIRECTOR, 2025-PRESENT
BIO
Toni McGovern is the Director of Sales of Hotel Melby with an impressive 15-year tenure in the dynamic world of hospitality management. With a vibrant energy and an unwavering passion for creating memorable experiences, Toni has significantly increased Occupancy and Revenue at Hotel Melby since taking on her role in 2021.
Having been enchanted by the charm of Melbourne since her first visit in the 2000s, she finally made Brevard County her home in 2016. This city, known for its vibrant arts scene and culinary delights, has captured her heart in a way that fuels her ambition: to position Downtown Melbourne as the ultimate destination for curious travelers seeking unique adventures.
Toni is deeply committed to her community, embodying the spirit of compassion by supporting local initiatives and advocating for rescue animals. When she’s not busy promoting Downtown Melbourne as a travel hotspot, you’ll likely find her exploring new corners of the city with her rescue dachshund Allie Mae or planning her next getaway, always with the aim of discovering and sharing hidden gems.
Erin Trauger
DIRECTOR, 2022-PRESENT
BIO
Erin is President of Trauger Consulting Engineers, Inc a Melbourne-based Civil Engineering design firm.  She has nearly 20 years of local experience in Civil Engineering including due diligence, conceptual efforts, design/permitting, and construction administration of development.
Erin and her husband, Jim Trauger, work together at their consulting firm located in Downtown Melbourne.  Their company project list includes commercial facilities, residential communities, industrial developments, and institutional improvements but additionally, Erin works on redevelopment projects for new updates and new life in Melbourne and other existing communities.  Erin views these redevelopment projects as wildly beneficial for developed areas and enjoys being part of the community improvements.  In the past, she served on the City of Melbourne Planning and Zoning board for six years and is excited to now be a small part of a great team that includes the Melbourne Main Street Board.  Her hopes are to serve and help further successes in an already thriving Downtown Melbourne.
Jason Williams
DIRECTOR, 2021-PRESENT
BIO
Jason Williams is the Chief Executive Officer and a Co-Founder of Cromulence LLC. Cromulence is a growing high technology business with primary offices located in Downtown Melbourne, Florida that specializes in cybersecurity capabilities and services for national defense.
Jason, a Melbourne native, is inspired by the potential to vitalize and enhance the Downtown Melbourne area and attract high tech industry and technology startups. He has seen firsthand the growth of Melbourne and the Space Coast as a hub for high tech industry, aerospace, and defense and wants to see the downtown area lead as a mixed-use area for employers, restaurants, and retail businesses.
Cindy Dittmer
2025-PRESENT, EX-OFFICIO
BIO
Kim Agee
EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, 2020-PRESENT, EX-OFFICIO
BIO
Kim Agee is a highly skilled community and economic development strategist and the current Executive Director of Melbourne Main Street. She is an experienced connector of ideas and people and is passionate about developing relationships within the business community that achieve success. Kim is a Past Board Chair of the Melbourne Regional Chamber of Commerce and currently serves on the Board of Directors and Governance Committee, a member of CivMil, LEAD Brevard, the Junior League of South Brevard, and the City of Melbourne’s Homeless Stakeholders committee.
Born and raised in Melbourne with deep family ties, Agee’s passion is her community. She loves putting her energy, dedication, and experience to work building Melbourne Main Street’s mission to strengthen the businesses in Downtown Melbourne.
When she’s not working, Kim can be found boating on the Intracoastal, traveling, hugging her family and puppy, cheering on the USF Bulls, and hosting some of the best events in town.
TEAM

EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, 2020-PRESENT
BIO

She is an experienced connector of ideas and people and is passionate about developing relationships within the business community that achieve success. Kim is a Past Board Chair of the Melbourne Regional Chamber of Commerce and currently serves on the Board of Directors and Governance Committee, a member of CivMil, LEAD Brevard, the Junior League of South Brevard, and the City of Melbourne’s Homeless Stakeholders committee.
Born and raised in Melbourne with deep family ties, Agee’s passion is her community. She loves putting her energy, dedication, and experience to work building Melbourne Main Street’s mission to strengthen the businesses in Downtown Melbourne.
When she’s not working, Kim can be found boating on the Intracoastal, traveling, hugging her family and puppy, cheering on the USF Bulls, and hosting some of the best events in town.
Tara Weigner
INTERIM MANAGER, EVENTS AND MARKETING
BIO
Tara Weigner has called Melbourne home for nearly six years and has a deep love for Downtown. As a former business owner in the district, she understands the importance of a thriving local community and is passionate about its continued growth. Tara is a proud mom of three and she enjoys being part of the dynamic spirit that makes Downtown Melbourne special. She looks forward to helping the area flourish and supporting the businesses that make it unique.
CONTINUE EXPLORING

He and his wife are both from Brevard County and are proud to raise their two children in Melbourne. Mr. Clevens earned his bachelor’s degree from Bowdoin College and holds an MBA from Emory University’s Goizueta Business School.
Matthew Flores
DIRECTOR, 2024-PRESENT
BIO
Matthew Flores, BRPH
Don Hemmenway
DIRECTOR, 2024-PRESENT
BIO
Don Hemmenway retired as a Senior Engineering Manager from Renesas Electronics in Palm Bay (formerly Harris Semiconductor) after a 40-year career in microelectronics design and manufacturing.  He was awarded 25 US and European patents, published numerous technical papers, and directly contributed to the implementation of multiple generations of tactical and strategic national defense programs.
Don and his wife, Cathy, raised four children in Brevard County and are extremely proud of their many accomplishments (including six grandchildren!).  In 2019 they moved to a permanent residence on Crane Creek in Downtown Melbourne. Since retirement in 2023, they enjoy daily walks down New Haven Avenue to the harbor, as well as partaking in the diverse dining, shopping, and entertainment opportunities downtown.
Don is passionate about applying his time and talents to improve both Downtown Melbourne and his local Crane Creek Landing community.  He is particularly inspired by the rich history of Downtown Melbourne and would like to improve how that story is delivered to enhance the visitor experience.
Corey Runte
IMMEDIATE PAST CHAIR, 2023;
DIRECTOR, 2019-PRESENT
BIO
Corey serves as Vice President at Certified General Contractors, Inc., located in Historic Downtown Melbourne, bringing a wealth of experience and a deep commitment to community to the Board. A resident of Melbourne Beach with his wife, Krista, and their three young sons, Corey actively engages in local initiatives. He serves as a member of the Economic Development Commission of the Space Coast and has previously chaired the boards of both Melbourne Main Street (MMS) and the City of Melbourne’s Historic & Architectural Review Board. His involvement in Main Street organizations spans over a decade, with a dedicated eight-year tenure at MMS. Corey is passionate about revitalizing Downtown Melbourne and offers the Board a unique and energetic perspective informed by his professional experience in construction and his long-standing commitment to community development.
Toni McGovern
DIRECTOR, 2025-PRESENT
BIO
Toni McGovern is the Director of Sales of Hotel Melby with an impressive 15-year tenure in the dynamic world of hospitality management. With a vibrant energy and an unwavering passion for creating memorable experiences, Toni has significantly increased Occupancy and Revenue at Hotel Melby since taking on her role in 2021.
Having been enchanted by the charm of Melbourne since her first visit in the 2000s, she finally made Brevard County her home in 2016. This city, known for its vibrant arts scene and culinary delights, has captured her heart in a way that fuels her ambition: to position Downtown Melbourne as the ultimate destination for curious travelers seeking unique adventures.
Toni is deeply committed to her community, embodying the spirit of compassion by supporting local initiatives and advocating for rescue animals. When she’s not busy promoting Downtown Melbourne as a travel hotspot, you’ll likely find her exploring new corners of the city with her rescue dachshund Allie Mae or planning her next getaway, always with the aim of discovering and sharing hidden gems.
Erin Trauger
DIRECTOR, 2022-PRESENT
BIO
Erin is President of Trauger Consulting Engineers, Inc a Melbourne-based Civil Engineering design firm.  She has nearly 20 years of local experience in Civil Engineering including due diligence, conceptual efforts, design/permitting, and construction administration of development.
Erin and her husband, Jim Trauger, work together at their consulting firm located in Downtown Melbourne.  Their company project list includes commercial facilities, residential communities, industrial developments, and institutional improvements but additionally, Erin works on redevelopment projects for new updates and new life in Melbourne and other existing communities.  Erin views these redevelopment projects as wildly beneficial for developed areas and enjoys being part of the community improvements.  In the past, she served on the City of Melbourne Planning and Zoning board for six years and is excited to now be a small part of a great team that includes the Melbourne Main Street Board.  Her hopes are to serve and help further successes in an already thriving Downtown Melbourne.
Jason Williams
DIRECTOR, 2021-PRESENT
BIO
Jason Williams is the Chief Executive Officer and a Co-Founder of Cromulence LLC. Cromulence is a growing high technology business with primary offices located in Downtown Melbourne, Florida that specializes in cybersecurity capabilities and services for national defense.
Jason, a Melbourne native, is inspired by the potential to vitalize and enhance the Downtown Melbourne area and attract high tech industry and technology startups. He has seen firsthand the growth of Melbourne and the Space Coast as a hub for high tech industry, aerospace, and defense and wants to see the downtown area lead as a mixed-use area for employers, restaurants, and retail businesses.
Cindy Dittmer
2025-PRESENT, EX-OFFICIO
BIO
Kim Agee
EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, 2020-PRESENT, EX-OFFICIO
BIO
Kim Agee is a highly skilled community and economic development strategist and the current Executive Director of Melbourne Main Street. She is an experienced connector of ideas and people and is passionate about developing relationships within the business community that achieve success. Kim is a Past Board Chair of the Melbourne Regional Chamber of Commerce and currently serves on the Board of Directors and Governance Committee, a member of CivMil, LEAD Brevard, the Junior League of South Brevard, and the City of Melbourne’s Homeless Stakeholders committee.
Born and raised in Melbourne with deep family ties, Agee’s passion is her community. She loves putting her energy, dedication, and experience to work building Melbourne Main Street’s mission to strengthen the businesses in Downtown Melbourne.
When she’s not working, Kim can be found boating on the Intracoastal, traveling, hugging her family and puppy, cheering on the USF Bulls, and hosting some of the best events in town.

LEADERSHIP IN DOWNTOWN MELBOURNE
Leadership and decision-making for Downtown Melbourne governs as
Melbourne Main Street
, a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization dedicated to revitalizing and enhancing the economic growth of the district. Get to know the Melbourne Main Street Board of Directors and committed team.
MELBOURNE MAIN STREET BOARD OF DIRECTORS
OFFICERS
Cassandra Hartford
BOARD CHAIR, 2024-PRESENT, DIRECTOR, 2021-PRESENT
BIO
Cassandra Hartford is a distinguished professional with years of experience in real estate and client relations. Currently, Cassandra occupies many roles that allow her to utilize her exceptional skill set to its fullest potential.
As a Real Estate Advisor, Cassandra aims to be a beacon of knowledge and guidance for all of her clients. Cassandra specializes in a variety of asset classes; anything from residential real estate, to commercial real estate, investment portfolios, and development. She is well-known for her dedication and unwavering commitment to each individual. Over the years, Cassandra has developed an ever-expanding network and continues to build lasting relationships with many loyal clients. As a passionate professional, Cassandra takes pride in staying up-to-date with current market trends. Her natural interest in real estate and innate desire to help others can be directly attributed to her stellar reputation and track record.
In her free time, Cassandra loves spending time with her family, tending to her Koi Fish, or catching a local music or comedy show. She also enjoys Improv Acting and giving back to her community.
Mike Hill
VICE-CHAIR 2025-PRESENT, DIRECTOR, 2024-PRESENT
BIO
Michael Hill is a small business owner, he and his wife co-manage Tuckaway Shores Resort in Indialantic, FL. He truly understands how important volunteering and community involvement is to the local community. That is evidenced by his active participation in local government and engagement in multiple organizations including Melbourne Main Street and the Melbourne Chamber of Commerce; organizations that promote and make a measurable impact to the local economy. His passion is contributing his time and efforts to the continued growth and revitalization of our local community, including historic downtown Melbourne.
Michael’s career began in the United States Army where he served for over 20 years with distinction and retired in 2004. He held numerous positions during his career from an Airborne Artilleryman to the Director of Training Development where he was responsible for the daily operations and management of the US Army Recruiting School. During his career he was stationed at Ft. Bragg, NC, Vicenza, Italy, Ft. Jackson, SC, and multiple assignments with the US Army Recruiting Command in the Northeast. Upon retirement from the US Army, Michael held multiple positions with both non-profit and for-profit companies in sales and operations roles. In those organizations he held local, regional, and V-level roles providing him exceptional experience that he leveraged to grow those organizations.
Michael loves spending time with his wife Pam, daughters Brandi and Kristi and his grandchildren Carolina and Caleb. He is very active and enjoys outdoor activities such as paddleboarding, biking, one-wheeling, downhill skiing, and paramotoring.
Lory Milton
TREASURER 2024-PRESENT, DIRECTOR, 2023-PRESENT
BIO
Lory Milton is the current Vice President, Commercial Loan Officer at Marine Bank and Trust.
She works closely with many small–business owners in the region building relationships to help business owners achieve their dreams.
Lory is a University of Central Florida graduate with a Bachelor’s in Criminal Justice, and a longtime resident of the Space Coast.
Growing up in Melbourne, Lory has enjoyed watching and being a part of the Space Coast’s growth and is excited for what the future holds for Downtown Melbourne.
Lory serves as PTO Vice President at her son’s school, is a Board Member of The Gift Angel Society, and enjoys volunteering with the Brevard Children’s Hunger Project.
Jordan Williams
SECRETARY 2024-PRESENT, DIRECTOR, 2023-PRESENT
BIO
Jordan Williams owns Downtown Divas in Downtown Melbourne as well as Tangled Rose, in Downtown Melbourne and Cocoa Village.  She has a special affinity for downtowns and will be bringing her fresh perspective and vision for social media marketing, content development, and event planning to the Board of Directors.
Jordan is looking forward to marketing DTMB as a destination for shopping, playing, and exploring while making deeper connections with the other businesses in Downtown Melbourne.

CONTACT DOWNTOWN MELBOURNE
Thank you for contacting Melbourne Main Street, the non-profit organization dedicated to revitalizing and enhancing Historic Downtown Melbourne. We’d love to connect with you. Please reach out to us via your preferred method of contact, and we look forward to getting in touch with you.what makes Downtown Melbourne an unforgettable shopping destination. No matter your taste, you’ll love it.
MELBOURNE MAIN STREET
2004 Vernon Place
Melbourne, FL 32901
321.724.1741
info@downtownmelbourne.com
EXPLORE DOWNTOWN MELBOURNE
Residing along the Indian River Lagoon and Crane Creek waterfronts, Historic Downtown Melbourne is a playground for all ages.
